snippet: Recent unapologetic selections reflect a conclusion in the West Wing that when it comes to choosing personnel, the president can never satisfy Republicans.
abstract: White House Memo; Pres Obama's defiant selection of Susan E Rice as his new national security adviser underscores newly assertive approach he has taken to appointments since abandoning potential cabinet nomination for Rice; latest unapologetic selections reflect conclusion in West Wing that when it comes to choosing personnel, president can never satisfy Republicans.
lead_paragraph: Recent unapologetic selections reflect a conclusion in the West Wing that when it comes to choosing personnel, the president can never satisfy Republicans.

headline.seo: In Naming of Appointees, Obama Chooses Not to Back Down
headline.main: In Personnel Appointments, Obama Takes Assertive Tack
